iti42:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti42:2.1: “These two bright things, mendicants, protect the world.
iti42:2.4: If these two bright things did not protect the world, there would be no recognition of the status of mother, aunts, or wives and partners of tutors and respected people.
iti42:2.5: The world would become dissolute, like goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and hounds and jackals.
iti42:2.6: But because the two bright things protect the world, there is recognition of the status of mother, aunts, and wives and partners of tutors and respected people.”
iti42:3.4: and fare on in birth and death.
iti42:4.1: Those in whom conscience and prudence
iti42:4.4: being at peace, they will not be reborn again.”
iti42:5.1: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
